Philip Shupe <Philip.Shupe@protonmail.com> Stored with zero-access encryption Sent10:33 AM To:info@eff.org Has 2 attachments

When I use the Tor browser on "cover your tracks," I get a 'Yes, Yes, Yes' next to the two blocking and one finger printing section. I am not sure how these 3 yes's compares with the responses I have gotten from your website on other occasions indicating, "You have a non unique fingerprint?"

More importantly, when I use the Firefox browser with exactly the same extensions set in the same way, I get the following results from one extension, and one premium security-privacy software when I evaluate the Firefox browser on 'cover your tracks':

and, image.png Site blocked by Adnauseum, [ibid]

So, It would be helpful to know if this, 'eviltracker.net' is part of the 'cover your tracks,' tool. Please let me know.

title: Cambio de CHROME a FIREFOX
content: Buenas tardes al Foro. Les escribo porque he pensado seriamente en cambiar de CHROME a FIREFOX (u otro buscador), porque Chrome viene presentando problemas con Windows10. El caso es que Chrome se cuelga y debo buscar el Administrador de Tareas de Chrome para finalizar procesos que consumen una enorme cantidad de CPU. El hecho es que cada día que pasa, el problema se agudiza y decidí cambiar. Debo indicar que escribí el caso al Foro de Google CHROME hace más de un mes y aun no recibo respuestas. Triste, porque anteriormente tenían un buen servicio de apoyo y ayuda. Debo indicarles que probé con EDGE y en principio todo migró correctamente. Sin embargo, como buen producto de Microsoft, es invasivo y lo hace paso a paso. Como ejemplo, si usted busca un video, lo hace BING y si usted envía ese enlace, hace que EDGE se abra en el dispositivo receptor y no el buscador predeterminado. Es el caso que actualicé FIREFOX y seguí las instrucciones para migrar todo lo que tengo en Chrome para Firefox y para ser franco, es un proceso complicado. Primero, las instrucciones que aparecen en la ayuda no especifican bienlos pasos. Es decir, asumen que uno ya sabe todos los pasos y lo dirigen a uno donde uno NO SABE COMO LLEGAR. Terrible. Luego de varios intentos, eliminar Firefox y montarlo nuevamente, aparentemente hay incompatibilidades de mi cuenta de Google y la cuenta de Firefox. Para muestra, aun espero que todos los marcadores migren y los que han migrado, ninguno tiene su icono con excepción de los más usados. Igual con la página principal que se monta la de Firefox que NO ACTUALIZA lo iconos y uno debe adivinar. Verdaderamente, no se que hacer; porque si esto sigue así, lamentablemente tendré que usar EDGE con sus limitaciones e invasividad. Obviamente, algunas extensiones no pasan y hay otras que,si bien deberían existir, aun no se como hacer para encontrarlas en FIREFOX ADD-ONS. S bien a la fecha cuento con 70 años, les indico que he venido trabajando con Internet, Correos, Buscadores y otras herramientas desde el año 1988. Y verdaderamente, cada vez las instruccions son menos explícitas y repito, no soy novato en esas lides. Pregunto: ¿Será posible procurar INSTRUCCIONES PASO A PASO para los novatos en Firefox y hacer la migración como debe ser? Si no es posible, ¿que puedo hacer? Cualquier observación, consideración o recomendación de su parte será bien recibida. Y por favor, no crean que por la edad, no puedo hacer cosas. Tengo experiencia, pero eso no vale de nada si los que dan información, no saben lo que es un servicioal usuario. Mil gracias de antemano, RAFAELE. LLAVANERAS Caracas -Venezuela
creator: rllavaneras

title: Hmm. We're having trouble finding that site
content:
Ever since I started using Firefox which was months ago, I've been getting this "Hmm. We're having trouble finding that site" page multiple times a day when opening links to various websites. Refreshing the page makes it load correctly. I've tried troubleshooting this in the past but didn't spend too much effort, but enough is enough. Things I have tried:

  • Disabling all extensions
  • Disabling hardware acceleration
  • I am using the default theme so there's nothing to disable there
  • Clearing the cache
  • Checking my internet connection (I'm connected and everything else works)
  • Flushing my DNS
  • Resetting Windows, which included reinstalling Firefox (I did this to fix something else, but still)
  • Disabling IPv6 and DNS prefetching
  • I am not using a Proxy

I feel like I've tried everything. What else can I do?

title: Is Firefox incompatible with Capital One Visa credit card "Eno" privacy feature?
content: Capital One Visa credit card offers a great feature that protects its cardholders' credit card numbers. It's called "Eno." When a cardholder is making an online purchase, Eno activates and provides a virtual credit card number for the cardholder to use instead of his/her actual credit card number. It appears Firefox is not compatible with Eno. Has Firefox ever worked with Capital One Visa to make these two systems compatible? Thank you.

title: Want to Save Image on Start up page
content:
Hello Mozilla Help Staff,

I have a question I hope you can help me with. While my laptop boots up I see a beautiful image on the screen of a forest with a path and lavender flowers on each side. In the past I could right click on it and a messsage would come up "do you like this photograph? or something similar. I could click "yes" then log in.

Once logged in, I would bring up my Firefox browser and there would be additional information about the image. I could then save the photograph to my Images folder.

For some reason, the "Do you like the image?" question doesn't come up at all. So I can no longer save these beautiful photographs.

I think the reason this question came up is so Firefox could categorize types of images users like to see, and possibly want to use for backgrounds.

It would be wonderful to be able to change backgrounds and use bootup photos for a background but, unfortunately, now I have no choice.

I hope Firefox goes back to the earlier format that allows users to set their computer background image.

Please send my request to your technical staff.

Thank you, Gloria Hovde ghovde@lake.org
creator: ghovde

title: Can't sign into account due to 2FA and verification codes not sent.
content:
So back in May 2FA was automatically set up for those of us who wanted to update our Mozilla Add-ons. I can see in my email account that I was informed of that and I must have logged in since I also have an email with a verification code from Firefox sent from accounts@firefox.com .

Fast forward to today, I try to log in and I'm asked a verification code. After reading all the docs I understand that I should have received another such email with a 6 digit verification code. I haven't. I tried to have it resent. It didn't. I waited. I have added accounts@firefox.com to my contacts, no luck. I can see from the email where 2FA was activated that I am on the same device I used back then. Since it is a Mac I'm not sure how to verify it since all verification is via email and I'm not receiving any emails. (even though, again, I had no issues to receive emails when the 2FA was set up)

I don't have the recovery codes (I'm not sure if I may have received them via email too?) and I am not logged into my Firefox account in any devices.

How should I proceed? This is very frustrating.

I can show proof of same device/email access etc if needed.

PS: I had to create this new account just to post a question.
creator: boixadosj

title: Issue in Firefox on punchout inbound. User is not redirected to shopping cart.
content:
Hi everyone, Users log in to our shop system from SAP via OCI. Our page is called from SAP in a frame. Then they connect again via OCI to an external Punchout shop. They add some products to the cart and the cart from the external shop is transferred back to our shop system via OCI. In Chrome, IE, Edge the user is then correctly redirected to our shopping cart page. But in Firefox, the redirection to the cart is not done and the users still see the Punchout inbound page which is empty. We already tried to switch off the Enhanced Tracking Protection for our site and the punchout site. But that didn't help. Have anyone has an idea what could fix the problem?

Any help will be much appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

Regards
creator: marek.paw
